snippet: The video released Wednesday that showed the transfer of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl to American troops provided the Taliban an opportunity to publicize their argument that they are a legitimate state in exile.
abstract: Video that shows the transfer of Sgt Bowe Bergdahl to American troops gives the Taliban an opportunity to publicize their argument that they are a legitimate state in exile; Taliban senior leadership struck a deal with United States that omitted the Afghan government, raising concerns among even some Afghan officials who did not object to the transfer itself.

byline.contributor: Hares Kakar contributed reporting from Kabul, and Helene Cooper from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: The video released Wednesday that showed the transfer of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl to American troops provided the Taliban an opportunity to publicize their argument that they are a legitimate state in exile.

headline.seo: Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl’s Release Displays Captors’ Savvy Propaganda Effort
headline.main: Taliban Deftly Offer Message in Video of Freed U.S. Soldier
headline.print_headline: Taliban Deftly Offer Message in Video of Freed U.S. Soldier
